meanings.definition: The act of preparing a preliminary version or sketch.
meanings.sent1: She enjoyed the draftings of her artwork before adding colors.
meanings.sent2: Architects often start with draftings before finalizing building plans.
meanings.sent3: The draftings of the birthday card made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His draftings of the map were like a treasure hunt waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The draftings on the whiteboard helped students understand the concept better.

meanings.definition: The process of selecting or recruiting individuals for military service.
meanings.sent1: The draftings for the army were conducted with precision.
meanings.sent2: During wartime, draftings are necessary to maintain military strength.
meanings.sent3: The draftings for the military were like assembling a team for a mission.
meanings.sent4: His draftings of soldiers resembled pieces moving on a chessboard.
meanings.sent5: The draftings of new recruits brought fresh energy to the unit.

meanings.definition: The act of drawing up legal documents or contracts.
meanings.sent1: The lawyer's draftings of the contract were thorough and clear.
meanings.sent2: Draftings of legal papers require attention to detail to avoid errors.
meanings.sent3: The draftings of the agreement were signed without any objections.
meanings.sent4: Her draftings of the will ensured everyone's interests were protected.
meanings.sent5: The draftings of the lease agreement were finalized after careful review.
